name: vscode-javascript-booster
description: Boost your productivity with advanced JavaScript refactorings and commands
author: Stepan Burguchev <me@sburg.net>

scripts.test: cd .. && npm run compile && cd client && CODE_TESTS_PATH=${PWD}/out/tests node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test

javascriptBooster.codemodDir.description: Specifies the directory containing workspace related code actions.

javascriptBooster.smartExtendFallbackCom.description: Specifies the fallback command that should be executed if the file is not supported by smart selection.

javascriptBooster.smartShrinkFallbackCom.description: Specifies the fallback command that should be executed if the file is not supported by smart selection.

tabWidth.description: Number of spaces the pretty-printer should use per tab for indentation. If you do not pass this option explicitly, it will be inferred from the original code.

useTabs.description: If you want the pretty-printer to use tabs instead of spaces, make this option true.

wrapColumn.description: Some of the pretty-printer code (such as that for printing function parameter lists) makes a valiant attempt to prevent really long lines. You can adjust the limit by changing this option; however, there is no guarantee that line length will fit inside this limit.

quote.description: If you have preferences for what type of quotes should be used in newly created string literals, specify this option.

trailingComma.description: Controls the printing of trailing commas in object literals, array expressions and function parameters. You can provide an object to specify settings for individual contexts.

arrowParensAlways.description: If you want parenthesis to wrap single-argument arrow function parameter lists, pass true for this option.

objectCurlySpacing.description: Controls the printing of spaces inside object literals, destructuring assignments, and import/export specifiers.

arrayBracketSpacing.description: Controls the printing of spaces inside array brackets.

javascriptBooster.formattingOptions.description: Specifies formatting options that will be used for newly generated code. Only the code fragment affected by a chosen code action is reformatted.
